params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.project_id
params.description: Required. The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: data.database_id
params.description: The ID of the database against which to make the request. '(default)' is not allowed; please use empty string '' to refer the default database.

params.name: data.mode
params.description: The type of commit to perform. Defaults to TRANSACTIONAL.

params.name: data.transaction
params.description: The identifier of the transaction associated with the commit. A transaction identifier is returned by a call to [Datastore.BeginTransaction][google.datastore.v1.Datastore.BeginTransaction].

params.name: data.mutations
params.description: The mutations to perform. When mode is TRANSACTIONAL, mutations affecting a single entity are applied in order. The following sequences of mutations affecting a single entity are not permitted in a single Commit request: - insert followed by insert - update followed by insert - upsert followed by insert - delete followed by update When mode is NON_TRANSACTIONAL, no two mutations may affect a single entity.

methods.name: getMutations
methods.description:
The mutations to perform.

When mode is TRANSACTIONAL, mutations affecting a single entity are applied in order. The following sequences of mutations affecting a single entity are not permitted in a single Commit request:

  • insert followed by insert
  • update followed by insert
  • upsert followed by insert
  • delete followed by update When mode is NON_TRANSACTIONAL, no two mutations may affect a single entity.

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.datastore.v1.Mutation mutations = 6;

  • delete followed by update When mode is NON_TRANSACTIONAL, no two mutations may affect a single entity.

Generated from protobuf field repeated .google.datastore.v1.Mutation mutations = 6;
